question: Is there any page limit of the short paper
answer:
Helpful references:
1. ACL2023: Calls: CALL FOR PAPERS: Main Conference: content: Paper Types and Formats: content: Long papers must describe substantial, original, completed, and unpublished work. Long papers may consist of up to eight (8) pages of content, plus unlimited pages of references and appendices. Final versions of long papers will be given one additional page of content (up to nine (9) pages), so that reviewers’ comments can be taken into account.
2. ACL2023: Calls: CALL FOR PAPERS: Main Conference: content: Paper Types and Formats: content: Short papers must describe original and unpublished work, and should have a small, focused contribution. Short papers may consist of up to four (4) pages of content, plus unlimited pages of references and appendices. Final versions of short papers will be given one additional page of content (up to five (5) pages), so that reviewers’ comments can be taken into account.

question: Is there any discounted virtual registration for the conference
answer:
1. ACL2023: Registration: Discounted Virtual Registration: content:  Discounted/sliding scale virtual registration is intended to make ACL events accessible to researchers who otherwise would be unable to participate. The application form for discounted and free virtual registration will be available on May 30th. Criteria for selection for financial aid will include your (a) country of residence, (b) employment position, (c) monthly income range, (d) available financial support from your employer/university, and (e) special circumstances. Given prioritization for those in greatest financial need, except in the case of special circumstances this additional funding is not intended for employed individuals and funded students from USA, Canada, Europe, Australia, New Zealand and higher income countries in Asia and the Middle East. Standard student registration rates (including from these regions) are already substantially discounted.
2. ACL2023: FAQ: Frequently Asked Questions: QA: A: No. Even if you do not register, the paper will appear in the proceedings. If you wish to present the paper in any way (either via a pre-recorded video, in-person spotlight, or virtual poster) one author must register for the conference. Findings papers presented at workshops need to register, at a minimum, at the appropriate workshop-only rate.

question: Will there be live-streamed sessions for those who can't attend in person?
answer:
1. ACL2023: Calls: CALL FOR PAPERS: Industry Track: content: Paper submission: Presentation Requirement for Accepted Papers: Industry track papers will be presented orally or as posters to be determined by the program committee. All accepted papers must be presented at the conference (either via online or onsite presence). All papers accepted to the Industry Track must be presented at the conference to appear in the proceedings, and at least one author must register for ACL 2023. The Industry Track paper sessions will run in parallel with the regular research paper sessions of the conference.

2. ACL2023: FAQ: Frequently Asked Questions: QA: A: We have no specific guidelines beyond those in the formatting instructions, and there are no disallowed packages per se. However, do not do anything that circumvents the spirit of the formatting guidelines by changing line spacing, font size, font family, etc. to unfairly fit text into a submission. Such submissions can be rejected.

question: Are students who are not first authors eligible to submit research papers in student research workshop?
answer:
1. ACL2023: Calls: CALL FOR PAPERS: Student Research Workshop: content: Eligibility: "Submissions must have student(s) as the primary author(s), and the research must have been carried out while all authors were students. Non-student co-authors are permitted, but the first author must be a student at the time of submission."
2. ACL2023: Calls: CALL FOR PAPERS: Student Research Workshop: content: How to Submit: "Student authors must substantiate their student status by uploading a proof-of-student document such as a valid student ID or an official letter from the student's institution. The proof-of-student document must cover the time of the research."
3. ACL2023: FAQ: Frequently Asked Questions: QA: F: "Are undergraduate or master’s students eligible to submit to the Student Research Workshop if they are not first authors?" A: "Yes, students who are not first authors but have made significant contributions to the research are eligible to submit to the Student Research Workshop. However, they must clearly explain their contributions to the research in the submission form."

question: Are students who are not PhD students eligible to submit thesis proposals in student research workshop?
answer:
1. ACL2023: Calls: CALL FOR PAPERS: Student Research Workshop: content: General Rules for Submission: content: This category is appropriate for PhD students who have decided on a thesis topic and wish to get feedback on their proposal and broader ideas for their continuing work.
2. ACL2023: Calls: CALL FOR PAPERS: Student Research Workshop: content: We invite papers in two different categories: Research Papers: Papers in this category can describe completed work, or work in progress with preliminary results. For these papers, the first author MUST BE a current student (graduate or undergraduate).
3. ACL2023: Calls: CALL FOR PAPERS: Industry Track: content: Frequently Asked Questions: question: Can students also submit papers to industry track?. (This reference is not directly related to the question, but it clarifies that students can submit papers to the industry track.)
